definition:
Natural numbers $a_1,a_2,\dots,a_n$ are called *mutually coprime* if
there is no $p\in\mathbb{N}$, $p>1$ with $p|a_i$ for all $i\leq n$. By
this definition for example $15$, $21$ and $25$ would be mutually
coprime though they are not *pairwise coprime*, because that would that
each pair of these numbers is coprime.
